alert.note: Alert for Loudon (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 24 at 10:21AM CST until February 25 at 12:00AM CST by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 230 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of east Tennessee, including the following counties, Anderson, Jefferson, Knox, Loudon and Sevier. * WHEN...Until 230 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1121 AM EST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Knoxville, Oak Ridge, Sevierville, Clinton, Alcoa, Jefferson City, Dandridge, Farragut, Oliver Springs, Louisville, White Pine, New Market, Rockford, Strawberry Plains, Halls, Lake Forest, Kimberlin Heights, Maloneyville, Mascot and Seymour. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
